model_answer: B: He starts by saying San Francisco needs a real voice in Congress, then details unfair party endorsement rules and a lawsuit over “changing the rules,” escalating his criticism. As campaign graphics and policy tiles appear, he contrasts progressives with corporate Democrats and says power must be taken, not given. He culminates with a direct on-air challenge inviting Pelosi to debate, while buttons and campaign lower-thirds keep his insurgent framing visible.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on public relations for help. Jaffe starts by acknowledging the problems of homelessness and housing crises but does not mention any specific actions to solve them. Later, when asked about his plans, he mentions that he thinks the city has all the tools it needs, implying that there is no need for federal intervention.

Therefore, the answer is (D).
